body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Garland Adams states that at the March term of the Lincoln Circuit Court 1861 -- he was indicted by the grand Jury -- of Lincoln County for carrying on his person concealed deadly weapons and for three successive courts thereafter he was present with his witnesses ready for trial and the case was contd by the commonwealth; Just before the Expiration of the Term of E L Van Winkle Esq he upon a representation of the facts agreed bifore the then Shriff H P Middleton to desmiss the Cause and your Petitioner paid no further attention to the case; but bifore the next court M H Owsly was Elected and finding the case still on docket took Jugment against your Petitioner at the March Term 1864 for the sum of $50 -- in the absence of this defendant which is now in full fine -- Now this defendant could prove the charge false at and malicious; if his witneses were here both of whom Viz Jos Innes and T Adams -- are now in the Army and he sais the charge was wholy false and unfounded, wherefore he prys your Excellency will remit the Comths part of Said fine -- as Petitioner is poor and the character he has always bourn is that of a peacable citizen
It was my understanding from E. L. Vanwinkle that the above named case was dismissed
I have asertained the above facts to be true since taking Judgment in the above case.

Respectfully
M H Owsly
Comlths Atty
Mr Adams desires if you think his cause made in the Petition and certificates abve ^meritorious^ that you will forward the remission to him at stanford at your Earliest Covenience

Lincoln Cir Ct
vs
Garland Adams
Concealed Weapons
$50 --
